sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Israel and Hamas begin a four-day truce ahead of the expected release of hostages, but the IDF warns Palestinians in southern Gaza not to head north.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Three people dead in Kherson after what Kiev says was an intentional Russian strike on civilians, while Moscow mourns the death of a reporter killed on the front line.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Hundreds take to the streets of Dublin in violent protests after stabbing injured five people, including three children.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Bulgaria's Prime Minister Nikolai Denkov tells Euronews that he feels his country is a hostage to the debate over Schengen enlargement.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Is Ridley Scott's new blockbuster Napoleon a beautiful production or a film riddled with inaccuracies?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: French viewers are divided.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: After weeks of fighting, the sound of birdsong from Israeli positions overlooking the ruins of northern Gaza,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: where Israel and en masse militants have begun a four-day truce.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Trucks packed with essential supplies have also entered the besieged enclave at the Rafah border crossing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Israel says four fuel tankers have also arrived.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The pause in fighting comes ahead of the scheduled release later today of some 50 Israeli hostages held by the militant group since the 7th of October.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: While there have been reports of gunfire inside the Gaza Strip, these displaced Palestinians say they are heading home.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: I have been living in Gaza for 45 days.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: I am a citizen of Gaza and I am a refugee.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: I hope that the calmer conditions will be in all parts of Gaza so that I can go and see the lost people and see what is left.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: But Israel has warned Palestinians living in canyons and towns in southern Gaza not to head north.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: To the residents of Gaza, the war is not over. Humanitarianism is temporary.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The northern Gaza region is a dangerous war zone and it is forbidden to travel there.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The northern part of Gaza is a dangerous war zone and it is forbidden to travel there. in Ukraine's Kherson region, where a Russian strike using cluster munitions killed three people and wounded five more on Thursday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Ukraine's Interior Minister Kim Evko says more than 60 residential buildings were damaged in the daylight attack.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: According to reports circulating on social media, Russian troops intentionally targeted civilians.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: More than a thousand kilometers away in Moscow, colleagues of a Russian war correspondent killed on Ukraine's frontline lay flowers outside the headquarters of a state television network. The Russian Ministry of Defense says Boris Maksudov died from injuries sustained in a drone attack in the Zaporozhye region while he was working on a story about Ukrainian troops allegedly shelling civilians.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The MOD also released this video of what it says are Russian soldiers firing a D-20 howitzer gun towards Kopyansk in the Kharkiv region.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Hundreds of rioters took to the streets of Dublin on Thursday night after a series of stabbing injured three children and two adults.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: One is in serious condition.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Agitators blamed Ireland's immigration policies for the stabbing and protesters fired flares and fireworks at the police cordon around the scene of the incident.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Police say the violent clashes mobilised more than 400 police officers. We have a complete lunatic hooligan faction driven by far-right ideology and also then this disruptive tendency here and engaged then in serious violence. Now we are drafting in resources to deal with that and that will be dealt with properly. Police say they have a definite line of inquiry regarding the stabbing and are not looking for anyone else in connection with the violence outside the school in the heart of the Irish capital.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: An investigation is ongoing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Bulgaria's Prime Minister Nikolai Denkov tells Euronews that he feels his country is a hostage to the debate over Schengen enlargement.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Denkov spoke to MEPs in the European Parliament in Strasbourg this week about his vision for Europe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: He says Bulgaria has fulfilled all the EU's criteria towards joining the Schengen zone.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: When I met the Chancellor Nehammer in Austria, he was very clear that he has no any problems with Bulgaria and Romania per se today.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: His problem is how the Schengen area is working in general.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: So this is more like a discussion between Austria and the European Union rather than between Bulgaria and Austria.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Of course, we are the victims of this situation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: As I said today, I feel a little bit as a hostage of this situation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: I hope that there will be a positive development in December.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: The prime minister also rejects criticism from Hungary and Serbia after Bulgaria announced plans to tax the transfer of Russian gas through its territory.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Both receivers of it, Budapest and Belgrade, fear that the measure will lead to higher fuel prices for their citizens.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: But the Prime Minister of Bulgaria says the law is not directed at them.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The way this tax is implemented does not put any requirements for payments from the receiving countries like Hungary or the other countries. It is defined in such a way that it should be paid by Gazprom and I had discussions with the Hungarian Prime Minister Orban with the Serbian Prime Minister, and I told them this is not against your citizens, we don't want to hurt them in any way.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: What we want is to take some of the profit of the Russian war machine, because it's fuelled by Gazprom, literally, in some way.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Bulgaria has previously blocked North Macedonia's EU membership talks over concerns at the rights of national minorities.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: The deal was reached on the issue last year, though, and Sofia has no further demands towards North Macedonia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: No, we have no further demands.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: There is a very clear decision from the last year, 2022.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: It is between North Macedonia and the European Union, actually. So this is a matter of negotiations with them, not with Bulgaria today. And we have no further requirements. What we expect is this agreement to be fulfilled by the side of North Macedonia, as it is expected. The Western Balkans entering the EU is in Bulgaria's interest politically and economically, but the prime minister warns that new countries must be true members of the union once they join.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Turkey's central bank has delivered another huge interest rate hike, pushing up its policy

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: rate by five points to 40 percent, the highest rate in 20 years.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Ankara is fighting an ongoing battle against double-digit inflation that has left households struggling to afford food and other basic goods.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Analysts welcomed the rate hike which was well above expectations. President Erdogan's unorthodox policy of cutting interest rates to fight inflation has been blamed for the country's economic turmoil.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The killing of a 22 year old student at the hands of a Hex boyfriend has highlighted the issue of violence against women here in Italy, triggering a heated political debate across the country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: We know that more than 100 women have been killed in the country since the beginning of the year, and these episodes are often referred to as femicides.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Now, the word femicide refers to a murder of a woman based on a gender.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Now, it's difficult to get an estimate of the total number of this type of murders in each European country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: What we do know is that Italy is not the country with the highest number of femicides in the EU.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: But despite that, the case has become the centre of a media storm that is not yet over.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Prime Minister Giordano Meloni vowed to raise more awareness on the issue and as a consequence of that, the Italian Parliament recently approved a new law introducing more protection for women.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Vigils, protests have been organised across the country in the past few days and a national rally has been called on Saturday, which is also the day that marks the International Day Against Gender Violence. Il rally nazionale è stato chiamato domani, che è anche il giorno che marca il giorno internazionale contro la violenza genetica.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Ora abbiamo parlato con un membro di Non Una Di Meno, un movimento femminista che sta dietro l'evento di domani.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: E qui è ciò che ci ha detto. Aspettate. Siamo a un punto di svolta perché molte più persone hanno preso coscienza di questo problema e penso che molte più persone si uniranno alle lotte per cambiare lo stato delle cose.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Troviamo anche mille proclami elettorali soprattutto dalle forze politiche al governo che però poi non stanno facendo nulla per arginare questi femminicidi se non appunto proporre delle risposte securitarie che però non servono a nulla perché ciò che è necessario è creare una cultura, affrontare il maschilismo e il sessismo come parte di un sistema che ci opprime a livello sistemico e istituzionale.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Giorgia Orlandi per Euronews in Rome.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: French and English-speaking film critics are divided on Ridley Scott's new blockbuster, Napoleon.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: In Fontainebleau, where the former French emperor once held residence, some viewers described the film as a grandiose and beautiful production, while others were disappointed by historical inaccuracies. I was there to witness the beheading of Marie Antoinette and all the other scenes. I was there to put the children in the shoes of the children.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Sometimes I was a little bit caught up by the character of Napoleon in his privacy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: I didn't see him quite like that, but after all, when he was there.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: But it's a magnificent film. It's been a je n'ai pas vu un film aussi grandiose.
